title: Study notes - Introduction to Psychology
content:
Psychology is the scientific study of behavior and mental processes
The nervous system is composed of the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nervous system
The endocrine system consists of glands that secrete hormones to regulate bodily functions
Memory processes include encoding, storage, and retrieval

title: Book notes - "The Catcher in the Rye" by J.D. Salinger
content:
Main character Holden Caulfield is a troubled teenager who has been expelled from multiple schools
The book explores themes of loneliness, isolation, and the loss of innocence
Caulfield's obsession with preserving innocence can be seen as a metaphor for his fear of growing up and facing the harsh realities of adulthood
The novel's controversial content and use of profanity made it a frequent target of censorship and banning

title: Travel notes - Planning a trip to Japan
content:
Researched flights and accommodations, looking at options in Tokyo, Kyoto, and Osaka
Identified key attractions to visit, including Tokyo Tower, Fushimi Inari Shrine, and Universal Studios Japan
Researched local customs and etiquette, including proper bowing and use of chopsticks
Created a packing list, including comfortable walking shoes and a portable Wi-Fi hotspot

title: Travel diary - Day 1 in Paris
content:
Date: April 1, 2023 

Today was my first day in Paris and it was amazing! I started the day with a croissant and coffee at a little café in Montmartre. Then I went to the Louvre Museum and spent the afternoon admiring all the beautiful artwork. In the evening, I walked along the Seine River and watched the sunset from Pont Neuf. I can't wait to see what the rest of my trip has in store.

title: Study notes - History of the Roman Empire
content:
The Roman Republic was founded in 509 BCE and lasted until the Roman Empire was established in 27 BCE
The empire reached its peak under the rule of Trajan in 117 CE, with territories spanning from modern-day Scotland to Egypt and Iraq
The empire's decline was marked by political instability, economic turmoil, and attacks from invading tribes and empires
The last emperor of the Western Roman Empire, Romulus Augustus, was deposed in 476 CE by the Germanic king Odoacer

title: Lecture notes - American Literature
content:
Date: February 28, 2023
Instructor: Professor Smith
Topic: Transcendentalism

Notes:

Transcendentalism is a philosophical movement that emerged in the mid-19th century in America
Key figures include Ralph Waldo Emerson, Henry David Thoreau, and Margaret Fuller
The movement emphasized the importance of individualism, self-reliance, and spiritual connection with nature
Transcendentalist literature often features themes of non-conformity, intuition, and the search for truth

title: Brainstorming notes - Creative writing prompts
content:
Write a story from the perspective of a tree that witnesses the passage of time
Imagine a world where everyone has a superpower, but the protagonist is the only one without one
Write a letter from a character to their future self, reflecting on their past experiences and future hopes
Create a scene that takes place in a completely white room with no doors or windows
Write a story that begins with the sentence, "It wasn't until I saw the blood that I realized I was in trouble."

title: Pizza recipe
content:
Ingredients: 
- Pizza dough 
- Pizza sauce 
- Cheese 
- Toppings of your choice 

Instructions: 
1. Preheat oven to 425°F (218°C) 
2. Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface 
3. Spread pizza sauce evenly over the dough 
4. Sprinkle cheese over the sauce 
5. Add toppings of your choice 
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted

title: Lecture notes - Principles of Microeconomics
content:
Microeconomics studies the behavior of individuals and firms in making decisions regarding the allocation of scarce resources
The law of supply and demand states that as the price of a good or service increases, the quantity demanded will decrease and the quantity supplied will increase
Elasticity measures the responsiveness of demand or supply to changes in price or income
Market failure occurs when the market fails to allocate resources efficiently, such as in the case of externalities or public goods

title: Research notes - Impact of social media on mental health
content:
Research has shown that excessive use of social media can lead to feelings of anxiety, depression, and social isolation
Social media use can create unrealistic expectations and lead to negative comparisons with others
Cyberbullying and harassment can also contribute to mental health issues
However, social media can also be a source of support and connection for individuals, particularly those who may be isolated or marginalized in their communities
